school.name: Zuyd Hogeschool | Zuyd University of Applied Sciences

projects.title: Amadeus/Accenture Sprintweek - Disruption Management
projects.description:
The sprint is a unique five-day process for answering key questions through prototyping and testing ideas with customers and/or stakeholders. It is a combination of business strategy, innovation, behavioural science, and design packaged into a consistent step-by-step process. Sprints offer a patch to solve big problems, test new ideas, get more done, and do it faster, also allowing you to have fun along the way.

We tried to solve the following objective during a collaborative session with many different experts from KLM/AF, Accenture and Amadeus:

“In case of cancelled, missed or delayed flights how might we exceed customer expectations with options to choose from based on passengers preferences and needs in order to increase NPS while at the same time lower costs?”

Four unique concepts were created which are now tested on their viability and feasibility.

projects.title: TEDx Nyenrode University
projects.description:
TEDxNyenrodeUniversity is an independently organized event focused on ‘Ideas worth spreading’. The event has been created by and for the community of Nyenrode Business University. 

The Puzzle of Learning is the theme for the second edition of TEDxNyenrodeUniversity. Our speakers from various fields will be showcasing thought-provoking, compelling and fresh ideas that have the potential to impact the future in a lasting way. Our event will look at learning from a multidisciplinary view.

As a commissionair in Sponsorship and Corporate Relations it was my responsibility to acquire enough funding to successfully execute the event.  Besides organising a TEDx it was also an incredible experience to work with so many different nationalities in a very educational setting,

projects.title: JOHN MOLSON MBA International Case Competition
projects.description:
The John Molson MBA International Case Competition is a not-for-profit event organized by a team of students from the John Molson School of Business at Concordia University in Montreal, Canada. The competition is open to top business schools worldwide, and is recognized as the largest case competition of its kind. Its main purpose is to bridge the gap between the corporate and academic world, which ultimately enriches both students and executives alike.

The competition lasted a week and existed out of multiple rounds. With three hours to prepare, we had to analyse and evaluate unpublished business cases using the skills, knowledge and experience acquired from our curriculum. We completely relied on our own abilities, as we had limited access to Microsoft Office software and no access to the internet. The final products were presentations in PowerPoint format where we had to demonstrate our ability to dig into a problem and develop a feasible solution.

Together with Lisanne Fijnheer, Jasper Kroon and Alexandros Visser, I represented Nyenrode in this competition. Working together with 36 universities from all over the world was an amazing experiences; the competitive, collaborative and triggering environment ensured that I was able to get the best out of myself.

projects.title: Winner of the Nyenrode Strategy Week
projects.description:
The Nyenrode Strategy week is part of the MSc in Management curriculum. Within one week, the groups had to deep dive in to several companies to thoroughly analyse them. After this analysis an in-depth advise and presentation had to be made; the best project could become winner of the Strategy week.

Together with my group members we had to analyse Hermes International SA and due to our hard work we won the competition.

projects.description:
The Nyenrode Business Game is a 2-day competition at the estate of Nyenrode. It's a unique opportunity to get a feeling of the total Nyenrode experience as a potential student for the Master of Science in Management. The case from this game was offered by Saatchi & Saatchi | Leo Burnett and consisted of creating a marketing-plan and presentation for the new Jeep Renegade.

Together with my groupmembers we won the competition and had a great time. Work hard! Play hard!

projects.title: La Rességue (“From ruins to more than just hospitality!”)
projects.description:
My graduation project involved an entrepreneurial project in which we were assigned to create a new business in France.
La Ressègue is a 20 hectare estate on the outskirts of Bergerac, officially located in Ginestet. There are two ruins at the estate which are in need of restoration. The goal of the project is to create a small high level cordial hospitality establishment for a selective group of business and private guests. 
Together with my group members we did research in the potential market, business possibilities and later on we applied concept development to come up with a potential successful concept

projects.title: 6th edition of the European Mise en Place Cup
projects.description:
The EMCup is the competition amongst the best European Hotel Management schools. This initiative of HotelloTOP, the networking organisation for graduates of International Hospitality Management Schools, and co-creator Mise en Place, has goals like building relationships, providing hands-on experience, broadening the horizon for education, building a bridge between students and employers (preceding the upcoming War on Talent), and linking young professionals to the industry.

With my fellow group members, we represented the Hotel Management School Maastricht in this competition with the following theme: the ‘Agenda for the Future – There is no Time to Waste!’, with 5 global issues playing the lead role.”

projects.title: Hospitality Excellence Program 2014
projects.description: As a representative of the Hotel Management School Maastricht I was selected to participate in the Hospitality Excellence Program 2014. This is a project organised by the KHN (Royal Dutch Hospitality Association) and is aimed at solving current ‘hot issues’ in the industry. The other participants are representing the other top Hotel Management schools in The Netherlands. There are five participating students per school divided in five groups, stimulating cooperation amongst hotel management talents. I am in the group of Corporate Social Responsibility and we are doing research for developing a consumer-based concept that will make the stay in a restaurant, café or hotel more satisfactory for persons with a mental or physical disability.

profile_positions.description:
Bleckmann is a logistics expert for omnichannel commerce with a high focus on the fashion industry.
As interim (project) manager at the Bleckmann site in Amsterdam, I was responsible for leading and setting-up a series of improvement projects for both operations and the commercial department.


A few examples of what I was responsible for:
✔ Improving and setting up the forecasting and planning methods (especially for inbound goods)
✔ Structure and re-organize the inbound process in both office & operations.
✔ Aiding in increasing production/efficiency and reducing waste in the process
✔ Supervising the annual launch of our A-tier client's winter collection.
✔ Organizing workshops, creating tooling and provide assistance to help colleagues increase their output.
profile_positions.title: Interim-projectmanager

profile_positions.description: ORGX is young and dynamic company with a belief that organizations should transform differently in becoming future proof. We guide organizations towards becoming meaningful companies, ensuring business continuity, while positively contributing towards society, with lowest possible environmental footprint.
profile_positions.title: Business Transformation Consultant & Customer Journey Analyst

profile_positions.description:
A start-up that allows local shopkeepers such as bakers, butchers, greengrocers, farmers and other local specialists to become future proof by selling their products online on our platform www.lokalist.nl. Basically, we provide a convenient and easy shopping experience for consumers, comparable to the larger (online) supermarkets. Customers can order products from nearby local shopkeepers/farmers and we make sure that they are collected, sorted and delivered. 
Working at a start-up means working like a jack of all trades. In the past months I have had a wide variety of responsibilities. I would like to highlight a few:

Build

✔Together with our website developer(s) I helped in setting up the platform. I consider myself as a hybrid between Business Analyst and product owner. Finding the right balance between an easy-to-work with back office (for the local entrepreneurs) and a customer friendly front end was (and is) key. Being the linking pin between business and development was both educational and fun.
✔Part of the above was setting up and maintaining the database with products and shops. Currently, we have about 25.000 products in our database with over 100 shops.
✔I have also set up our digital marketing tool (Active Campaign) and was responsible for working with Voucherify which generates and distributes our coupons and discount codes.

Measure

✔ Part of a start-up is measuring whether you are doing the right thing. I followed various PowerBI and SQL trainings in the last year I have built many different dashboards for various colleagues and provided key insights and analyses on a regular base with regard to how we are performing.

Learn 

✔As a team we are working on making the Lokalist happen. This means understanding our customers via design thinking and journey mapping, creating value for them through our concept and making sure that we are doing the right thing.
profile_positions.title: Business Analyst

profile_positions.description: After traveling, finding a job during 'Corona' was a bit of a challenge. All of the Netherlands was in lockdown as was the job market. I tried to make the best out of this period by helping out the people around me. While looking for a job I did things such as painting my grandfathers’ shed, giving digital tutoring in mathematics and helping people out with their gardening.
profile_positions.title: Making the best out of Covid 19

profile_positions.description: After finishing my traineeship with KLM, my girlfriend and I decided that we wanted to see something more of the world. The past year we have lived, worked and traveled in Australia, New Zealand and Asia.
profile_positions.title: Traveling through Australia, New Zealand and Asia

profile_positions.description: The KLM Corporate Management Traineeship consists of a two year program in which four projects in various KLM business units and an intensive training program are completed.
profile_positions.title: Corporate Management Trainee

profile_positions.description:
My last project was as a.i. E-Sales manager at the KLM Digital department. For the regions Canada, US, Belgium and Luxemburg I was responsible for optimizing the digital sales performance via the PoS websites. For this I functioned as a linking pin between the (de-central) markets and the centralized digital parties. As an extra project I was co-responsible for setting up an improved communication platform for all commercial parties within KLM Digital by using the Design Thinking method.

Role: Projectmanager
profile_positions.title: Project 4: E-Sales manager of the US, Canada, Belgium and Luxemburg at KLM Digital

profile_positions.description:
My third project was to be assistant manager of the KLM Ground Service Training department for platform related training. My main responsibility was leading a team of trainers and content developers on a daily basis. I also had to collaborate with the line managers to ensure that sufficient training was provided on time. Furthermore, I helped with improving and digitizing training methods and worked on improving the overall training quality. Additionally, I aided management with working towards a new training organization for all of KLM Ground Services. Finally, I implemented working with Microsoft Teams within this operational environment.

Roles: Teamlead
profile_positions.title: Project 3: Assistant Manager of the KLM Ground Service Training department (Apron Services)

profile_positions.description:
The second project was split up in two roles. The first one was to be the personal assistant of the EVP of AFKL Cargo. I assisted him with daily matters such as making minutes for the AFKL Cargo board, creating presentations and preparing required documentation. It was very educational to work in a C-suite environment for six months. My second role was as program manager for ‘What Counts’ in Europe. What Counts was set up to further enhance AFKL Cargo’s (digital) services for small and medium-sized customers. I was responsible for rolling out a new digital proposition in the UK, Germany, Italy and Spain. This included things such as creating and providing training in those countries, creating live dashboards and working on the further digital development of the program with the Digital/Marketing team. As a sideproject I assisted in implementing Salesforce in the commercial department of AFKL Cargo.

Roles: Management Assistent / PMO / Productowner
profile_positions.title: Project 2: Program Manager What Counts at AFKL Cargo Europe and assistant to the AFKL Cargo Board.

profile_positions.description:
My first project was to aid the program manager ‘Disruption Management’. The program’s aim was to reduce the effects of a (mass) disruption for our operation and customers. The program had just launched when I started and thus I was co-responsible for doing research, creating strategy via the OGSM model, organizing and participating in brainstorm sessions, creating new concepts with the Design Thinking method and implementing solutions in the OCC. I also helped creating a tender for a data based decision making tool and worked on improving the communication with customers during a disruption.  The scope of the program was company wide, therefore I had the opportunity to see and work with many departments within KLM.

Roles: Business Analyst
profile_positions.title: Project 1: Disruption Management at the KLM Operations Control Center (OCC)

profile_positions.description:
As an intern at EME Hospitality Projects I was part of a team which was responsible for the organisation of the World EXPO 2015 in Milano. My job included a wide variety of tasks which were all related to the preparation of this six month event which started in May 2016 (logistics, suppliers, marketing etc.).

About the World EXPO Holland:
Share, Grow, Live is the theme chosen to evoke the Dutch way of production, distribution and consumption of food on a global scale, where the pavilion enclosure is envisioned as a place of unexpected experiences that will both pique curiosity and entertain. The space was designed as an anti-pavilion, a sort of Luna Park composed of a sequence of spaces of different sizes and colours, each one able to host exhibitions and events in an open, free-flowing arrangement.
profile_positions.title: F&B Concept Development

profile_positions.description:
During my last year in Maastricht I was asked to join the food and beverage team of the Teaching Hotel. They needed 'supervisors' to help out the Food & Beverage managers. As the Teaching Hotel is completely run by 1st year students, it is crucial that they have supervisors to supervise them on the floor and coach them in their learning.

•	Able to work in all areas of Food & Beverage including Bar, Restaurant and Banqueting
•	Assist & supervising 1st years Hotel Management students in their educational process at the F&B department
•	Give training and share knowledge with 1st year Hotel Management students
•	Welcome guests in a polite and friendly manner
•	Prepare set ups for tables and/or banqueting operations
•	Follow cash handling procedures
•	Ensure cleanliness of work areas
•	Comply with hotel security, fire regulations and all health and safety legislation
•	Assist F&B management where necessary
profile_positions.title: Assistant Food & Beverage Supervisor

profile_positions.description:
The Teaching Hotel Château Bethlehem is completely run by students. Supervisors and hospitality experts are present to guide them to maintain professional standards but other than that they are responsible for all operation. As first year students are not allowed to do Night Shifts, older students can do these as a part-time job

▪ Processing of financial files such daily flash report andhotel revenue reports
▪ Keeping the management team and colleagues updated with a professional duty report.
▪ Carried out all customer related front desk duties like checking in, checking out guests, progressing, uest registration cards, answering phone calls etc.
▪ Addressed guest inquiries that occurred during night time. ( In various departments like F&B and HK)
▪ Ensuring guests' safety.
profile_positions.title: Night audit Employee

profile_positions.description:
As a F&B trainee I have worked most of my time in the All-Day-Dining restaurant of the InterContinental Pudong Shanghai. Starting with mainly operational tasks I learned the basics of F&B in a big hotel. Afterwards I worked as a restaurant supervisor where I was responsible for 15 international staff members.

During my internship I had possibilities to learn more about revenue-management and to join revenue-meetings. Besides that I had some in-depth Food & Beverage assignments to help me get a better understanding of managing such a department. 
I assisted the Intercontinental Hotel Group (IHG China) with the organisation of a Cuisine for Charity event where all IHG hotels in the Shanghai region where contesting in different F&B Categories. 
In my internship period I learned a lot of new things, not only about the work and the hospitality business but also about cultural and social aspects of working, living and leading in an Asian country.
profile_positions.title: Food & Beverage trainee

volunteer_experiences.description: Currently, I am the treasuer of my handball association with about 200 active members.
We (my girlfriend and I) help a nearly blind couple with various daily things such as their administration, going for walks or enabling them to go to events or fun activities.

Nyenrode uses Alumni Peer Group Coaching (PGC) within the Executive MBA, Full-Time MBA and full time MSc programs to build a group of supportive and bonded students and to familiarize them with and strengthen their individual coaching skills. Groups of 6-7 students come together, each one bringing something they find challenging during their study, career or in personal life. 

Currently, I am coaching a group of seven students who are following the MSc track on Nyenrode in these difficult times.

volunteer_experiences.role: Interviewer during the selection process for new students
volunteer_experiences.description: As an alumni I help with interviews during the selection process for new students of the Hotel Management School Maastricht.

During my traineeship at KLM I volunteered by helping senior management to improve the D&I situation within the company. I was part of the kickstart team and functioned as an ambassador of diversity and inclusion within the company where I helped the project leader with all kinds of tasks such as making strategy and working out goals.

A campus environment needs more inspiration! That was the mindset when we decided to organize a TEDx licensed event at Nyenrode. We chose the theme 'The Puzzle of Learning' - with expert speakers on learning related to education, technology, sociology, medicine and communication.

I was part of an international 10-person event team to make this event happen. After various project proposals, sales pitches and budgetary calculations, we achieved stakeholder buy-in to fully fund the project. The result was a marvellous day of ideas worth spreading.

volunteer_experiences.role: Chairman of the Financial Controlling Committee (KCC)
volunteer_experiences.description:
As the chairman of the financial controlling committee it is my main responsibility to oversee the KCC which is responsible for checking the financial situation of our student association the NCV.

The KCC is a group of students that monitors the financial accounts of the association, the main task of the committee is to check the annual accounts prepared by the treasurer. Furthermore, the Audit Committee may express an opinion on the financial policy pursued. The committee also checks the budget prior to the period involved.

volunteer_experiences.role: Vice-Chairman of het Collegie tot het Protocol
volunteer_experiences.description: As a member of het Collegie tot het Protocol you are a representative of the Nyenrode University and the MSc Program. It is our task to promote Nyenrode and to make potential Nyenrodians excited to come and join us by assisting Nyenrode University on several occasions such as open days, business games, campus tours, graduation ceremonies and other commemorations. Moreover, het Collegie tot het Protocol is responsible for passing on traditions, norms and values to new generations of Nyenrodians and also preserving those longstanding traditions.

volunteer_experiences.role: Chairman of het Dispuut der Welsprekenden (Debating Committee)
volunteer_experiences.description: Het Dispuut der Welsprekenden is a committee in support of public speaking and debating. The members of the Fraternity regularly participate in (inter)national business or debate related competitions. One of the major competitions we joined is the John Molson MBA International Case Competition which is in Montreal, Canada. Besides participating in competitions, het Dispuut der Welsprekenden supports the practicing of speaking in public at Nyenrode Business University

The Rugbyclub Nijenrode is the oldest sport committee of Nyenrode (founded in 1947) and has as its main goal to practice and play Rugby. Rugby as a sport can bond players of all ages and this shows in the annual homecomings where different generations come back to share this passion. Due to a high study pressure the Nijenrode team only participates in student competitions and friendly matches. Besides playing rugby, there are multiple social activities that improve the bond between members.

This new committee is aimed at increasing the collaboration with the student association N.C.V and the business environment. Its main goal is to raise funds to increase the living environment on the Nyenrode Campus. Finding potential sponsors, working on current relations and setting up a new committee proved to be very educational.

During my time at Amphitryon I functioned as an event coordinator at multiple events for the student association Amphitryon. I had various functions in the different fields such as logistics and Food & Beverage. The biggest event was a festival for a few hundred students in which I was responsible for organising all the facilities.

volunteer_experiences.role: Member of the Financial Auditing Committee
volunteer_experiences.description: As a member of the Kas Controle Commissie ( Financial auditing Committee) I represented the members of Student Association Amphitryon by checking the ledgers and balance sheets of the student association Amphitryon. The KCC is a group of students that monitors the financial accounts of the association, the main task of the committee is to check the annual accounts prepared by the treasurer. Furthermore, the Audit Committee may express an opinion on the financial policy pursued. The committee also checks the budget prior to the period involved.

volunteer_experiences.role: Chairman of the Media and Web Committee

volunteer_experiences.description:
As a member of the student-council I was responsible for executing the tasks that were being divided by the chairperson. As a student council we had regular meetings to see what could be improved at the Hotel Management School Maastricht (HMSM). 

The main goal was to aid students with their life at the HMSM and to assist them as a mediator between them and the HMSM. I was in charge of maintaining the relations between the International students and the rest of the community. A few of my tasks were to give presentations to new (international) students and assist the school at various public events.

Help Elkaar Stichtse Vecht is a newly started charity foundation that tries to help those who need it most in our municipality. We aim to do this by bringing together the demand and offer for help via HipHelpt. We are setting up and aiding local initiatives to improve the living conditions for all those that are in a vulnerable situation.
